abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Agricultural Sector
            Adjustment/Investment Project for Mali are as follows:
            outcome of the project was satisfactory, project
            sustainability is likely, and the performance of the Bank
            and the Borrower also rated as satisfactory. Some of the
            lessons learned from the project are: (i) sectoral reforms
            should be accompanied by adequate complementary sectoral
            investments in order to have a major impact; (ii) a
            well-coordinated, multi-donor effort is essential for
            greater impact of sector investments because of the
            resulting synergy and complementarities as the experience of
            Third Southern Mali Rural Development Program (Mali-Sud III)
            attests; and (iii) sector reforms and investments should be
            carefully placed within an agreed overall macro framework
            and long-term sector development program as exemplified by
            the positive impact that devaluation and the low
            inflationary environment had on agricultural production,
            particularly cotton.
